content.question:
A researcher is studying a specific type of cellular defect in animal cells. She notices that cells with this defect have reduced energy storage and decreased cell membrane stability. 

Which of the following predicts the type of cellular defect that is the most likely cause of the researcher’s observation?

choices.label: A defect in fatty acid synthesis, reducing the formation of fats and phospholipids
A defect in cholesterol synthesis, leading to reduced cholesterol in cell membranes
A defect in steroid hormone production, leading to a depletion of energy reserves
A defect in unsaturated fatty acid production, affecting membrane fluidity

content.answer: A defect in fatty acid synthesis, reducing the formation of fats and phospholipids

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
